I should mention that while the Schwartz-Zippel-DeMillo-Lipton lemma is invoked in the notes below, one could make do with just the fact that over any field F, any degree n polynomial has at most n roots, as pointed out by @dsivakumar â€” thanks!

In the fourth slide from the end, why [DeMilloâ€“Lipton]â€“Schwartzâ€“Zippel Lemma? You only need that number of roots of a polynomial (over Z mod q) of degree n is no more than n. You don't need D-L/S/Z, which gives a general version for multivariate polynomials, right?
